backgroundRationale: The Integrated Status adn Effectiveness Monitoring Program has a lead biometrician that assists ISEMP cooperators data and GIS analysts in interpretation and statistical analysis of data. The biometrician collaborates with ISEMP technical staff to extract information from existing data sets to: (i) understand the role monitoring methods play in determining data quality and utility; (ii) develop recommendations on monitoring methods; (iii) develop models to identify limiting factors and guide resource management decision making; and (iv) develop a data analysis framework that will form the basis of future data collection and management efforts. The data analysis component of the project will require significant data reduction, description, and summarization through standard univariate and multivariate approaches. More intensive statistical applications may be required to explain complex interactions, such as classification and regression trees (CART), multivariate adaptive regression splines (MARS) analyses, and Structural Equation Modeling.

objectives: Provide technical and analytical support to ISEMP staff and cooperators
keyAssumptions: Analytical Approaches assumed used: - Multivariate and univariate statistical models of salmonid habitat and population data. - Spatial / temporal variance decomposition based salmonid habitat and population data analysis - Landscape-scale classification system for salmonid habitat for fish-habitat data analysis support - structural equation modeling of salmonid habitat and population data
dataHandlingConsiderations: Data QA/QC is completed at the project level before submittal to ISEMP Biometrician
name: Smolt to Adult Return Synthesis: ISEMP Data Analysis YKFP
